p: Flavonoids are synthesized via the phenylpropanoid metabolic pathway, which is regulated by numerous enzymes such as pal, chs, chi, and fls etc. These enzymes are induced by light conditions in both direct and indirect mechanisms [ 33, 34]. Some recent reports showed that each plant species has often independently absorbed a specific light requirement for its maximum secondary metabolites including flavonoids. For example, a high amount of flavonoids of Zingiber officinale [ 35], Lithocarpus litseifolius [ 36], and Labisa pumilar [ 37] were accumulated under lower light intensity, while soybean ( Glycine max) yielded a high amount of flavonoids under high light intensity [ 38].
